intro: Clypeola calycina, commonly known as the pink sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are usually erect and branching. Clypeola calycina is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
